result.markdown: --- title: "Introduction" --- ### Content ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |S |Content | Slides | PDF | Videos | SAS | R | |:--|:-------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------:| |0 |Course Outline |[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w0_syllabus.html)|[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w0_syllabus.pdf)|[](https://youtu.be/luOkCcpDSjs)| | | |1a |Hypothesis Tests |[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w1a_tests.html)|[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w1a_tests.pdf)|[](https://youtu.be/TSMuEX8FqYo)|[](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/files/code/MATH60604A_1a_test.sas)|[](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/files/code/MATH60604A_1a_test.R)| |1b |Central Limit Theorem |[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w1b_clt.html)|[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w1b_clt.pdf)|[](https://youtu.be/nCUT05szKwQ)| | | |1c |Exploratory Data Analysis |[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w1c_eda.html)|[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w1c_eda.pdf)|[](https://youtu.be/5Yc46pAQpFk)|[](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/files/code/MATH60604A_1c_eda.sas)|[](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/files/code/MATH60604A_1c_eda.R)| ::: ::: - Course notes: chapter 1 and Appendix A - Create an account on **SAS** onDemand - Complete the [Introduction to **SAS**](sas.html) ### In class: - Presentation and practice of pedagogical tools (Zoom / Wooclap / SAS onDemand) - [Graphics workshop (group)](https://github.com/lbelzile/statmod/raw/main/files/workshop/graphics.zip) ### After class: - `intro` quiz (self-assessment) - Exercise 1.4 (a-b) with **SAS**. The whole exercise sheet may be somewhat difficult at this stage, but you should (be able to) complete it in the upcoming weeks. ### Additional readings: - [Chapter 1 of *Data Visualization: A practical introduction* by Kieran Healy](https://socviz.co/lookatdata.html#lookatdata) - [Permutation tests](https://www.jwilber.me/permutationtest/) - [DataViz Cheatsheet](https://policyviz.com/2018/08/07/dataviz-cheatsheet/) - [Chapter 7 of _**R** for Data Science_ by Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) ### Other references: - [Chapter 3 of _**R** for Data Science_ by Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) - [*Fundamentals of Data Visualization* by Claus O. Wilke](https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/) - [Do's and don'ts of making effective graphics](https://stat545.com/effective-graphs.html) - [Financial Times Visual Vocabulary](https://github.com/ft-interactive/chart-doctor/tree/master/visual-vocabulary) - [BBC R Cookbook (optional)](https://bbc.github.io/rcookbook/) - [What's going on in this graph?](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/10/learning/over-60-new-york-times-graphs-for-students-to-analyze.html)
